law.catch_line: There is an Animal Waste Technology Fund in the Department....

text.section: There is an Animal Waste Technology Fund in the Department.

The goal of the Fund is to encourage the development and implementation of economically feasible technologies that help protect the public health and the environment by reducing the amount of nutrients from animal waste to enable farmers to meet nutrient management requirements and provide alternative animal waste management strategies to farmers.

section.section: The Department shall administer the Fund;

The Secretary may:
Delegate to any unit in the Department the underwriting, closing, monitoring, and workout functions for Fund loans; or
Contract with another entity to perform these functions.
The Fund is a special continuing, nonlapsing fund that is not subject to reversion under § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
The State Treasurer shall hold the Fund separately, and the Comptroller shall account for the Fund.

text.section:
The Department may use money in the Fund to:
Provide financial assistance to defray the costs of animal waste technology projects; and
Pay expenses for administrative, actuarial, legal, and technical services associated with operating the Fund.
The Department may impose terms and conditions on financial assistance provided from the Fund, including administration and transaction fees.

Financial assistance provided from the Fund may be:
Used only to pay the costs of carrying out an animal waste technology project; and
In the form of:
A grant;
A loan;
A loan guarantee; or
A loan that is convertible in whole or in part to a grant on the satisfaction of specified conditions.
